summary:
The DC-10 is a large passenger airplane made by McDonnell Douglas in the United States. It has three engines and a wide body with two aisles. The plane first flew in 1970 and was used for long flights. There were different versions, some with longer ranges. It could seat around 270 people.

Early on, the DC-10 had safety issues, including a deadly crash in 1974. After improvements, it became safer. Production ended in 1989, and it was replaced by the MD-11. Some DC-10s are still used for cargo and special purposes, like eye surgery and firefighting.
title: McDonnell Douglas DC-10
